predicate.note: Frames file for 'feel' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus, and comparison with 'believe'

role.descr: entity to or for whom the emotion is directed

example.name: under pressure
example.text: The colony's consumers feel more pressured than those in any of the other surveyed markets.
example.arg: more pressured than those in any of the other surveyed markets

example.name: all args
example.text: Andrew felt an almost unbearable tenderness for Addiline

example.name: government believer
example.text: The government of President Carols Menem feels a significant reduction of principal and interest is the only way the debt problem may be solved.
example.arg: The government of President Carols Menem
a significant reduction of principal and interest is the only way the debt problem may be solved

example.name: both and emotion and a belief
example.text: We feel very strongly that we really need action across the full range of issues we've identified.
example.arg: we really need action across the full range of issues we've identified

example.name: sensory
example.text: John felt the lush grass on the skin of his back.
example.note: "On the skin of his back" is not a locative because that would imply that the grass was growing on his back, which would be a little nasty.

example.name: as comfy as
example.text: ``The mountain bike feels as comfortable as the `paperboy' bike you had as a kid, but it can do so much more,'' he says.
example.arg: comfortable as the `paperboy' bike you had as a kid
